util.sequence

Class Arrayz<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.sequence.Arrayz<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the type of the array.

    public class Arrayz<A>
extends java.lang.Object
    Convenience methods, mainly useful for testing Streams methods.

    • Method Summary

        public static <T> boolean isNullOrZeroLength(T[] ts)
        Is the given array reference null or is the array length 0?
        Parameters:
        ts - the array to test.
        Returns:
        true for yes; false for no.

      • hasNulls

        public static <T> boolean hasNulls(T[] ts)
        Does the given array hold any null reference?
        Parameters:
        ts - the array to test.
        Returns:
        true if the array has at least length 1 and one of its elements is null; false if the array is null, or has no elements, or all of its elements are not null.

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.List<T> asList(T... ts)

        Parameters:
        ts - the array to convert.
        Returns:
        the array's elements collected into a list.

      • filter

        public A[] filter(java.util.function.Predicate<A> p,
                  A[] list)
        Collects the elements of the given list that satisfy the specified predicate. Elements are collected in the same order as they appear in the input list.
        Parameters:
        p - the test to decide which elements to take.
        list - the input list.
        Returns:
        a new list with the elements that satisfy p.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any argument is null.
